question: Consider the Strategic Alliance Agreement between Lion Biotechnologies, Inc. and The University of Texas M. D. Anderson Cancer Center for Cancer Research; What is the governing law for this contract?
context: This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of Texas, United States of America, without giving effect to any conflict of laws provisions.
answer: The governing law for this contract is the laws of the State of Texas, United States of America, without giving effect to any conflict of laws provisions.

question: Consider the Collaboration Agreement between F. Hoffmann-La Roche Ltd, Hoffmann-La Roche Inc., and Foundation Medicine, Inc. for Genomic Testing Platforms; Is there a most favored nation clause in this contract?
context: FMI agrees that the pricing terms for Products and Services provided by FMI to Roche herein, and services provided under the Molecular Information Platform Program, are, and will be, at least as favorable as the pricing terms granted by FMI to any existing customer or collaborator for such (or substantially similar) products or services. If FMI enters into any subsequent agreement with another customer or collaborator which provides for pricing terms for substantially the same product or services at substantially the same (or a lesser) scale, which pricing terms are more favorable than those contained herein, then FMI shall notify Roche and Roche will have the right to modify this agreement to provide Roche with those more favorable pricing terms. […***…].
answer: Yes, there is a most favored nation clause in this contract. The context specifies that Foundation Medicine, Inc. (FMI) agrees to provide Roche with pricing terms that are at least as favorable as those granted to any other customer or collaborator for similar products or services. If FMI enters into a subsequent agreement with another customer with more favorable terms, Roche has the right to modify the agreement to match those terms.

question: Consider the Consulting Agreement between Gunston Consulting, LLC and Medalist Diversified REIT, Inc.; What happens in the event of a change of control of one of the parties in this contract?
context: In the event of a 'Change of Control' of Company, then if CONSULTANT's services are terminated without cause at any time within a twelve (12) month period following such Change of Control, CONSULTANT shall receive a termination fee equal to twelve (12) months compensation hereunder at the then current monthly rate, including any stock compensation.
answer: In the event of a change of control of Medalist Diversified REIT, Inc. (the Company), if Gunston Consulting, LLC's services are terminated without cause within twelve months following the change of control, Gunston Consulting, LLC will receive a termination fee equivalent to twelve months of compensation at the then-current monthly rate, including any stock compensation.

question: Consider the Sponsorship Agreement between Excite, Inc. and N2K Inc. for Exclusive Retail Music Store Sponsorship; What licenses are granted under this contract?
context: Subject to the terms and conditions of this                   Agreement, Sponsor hereby grants to Excite a royalty-free,                   non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce,                   distribute, transmit and publicly display the Content in                   accordance with this Agreement and to sub-license the Content                   to Excite's wholly-owned subsidiaries or to joint ventures in                   which Excite participates for the sole purpose of using,                   reproducing, distributing, transmitting and publicly                   displaying the Content in accordance with this Agreement
answer: The contract grants Excite a royalty-free, non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, reproduce, distribute, transmit, and publicly display the Content provided by the Sponsor. Excite is also allowed to sublicense the Content to its wholly-owned subsidiaries or joint ventures for the same purposes.

question: Consider the Collaboration Agreement between Capsugel US, LLC and Cardax, Inc. for Product Development and Commercialization; What are the audit rights under this contract?

Additionally, Cardax has the right to have a third-party accounting firm, under a non-disclosure agreement, audit Capsugel's financials related to Net Sales and Adjusted Net Sales.

question: Consider the Joint Venture Agreement between IMPCO Technologies Inc. and Minda Industries Limited for MINDA IMPCO Technologies Limited; Does this contract include any right of first refusal, right of first offer, or right of first negotiation?
context: After the expiry of the five (5) year period, if a Party intends to sell any or all of its shares of the JVC (the "Transferor"), it shall first make an offer by a written notice to the other Parties (the "Transferee") to purchase such shares and the other Parties shall have the right to purchase the offered shares in proportion of their existing shareholding. . If any of the Transferees intends to purchase all or any portion of the said shares so offered, such Party shall dispatch a written notice of acceptance to the transferor describing the number of the shares it intends to purchase within three (3) weeks after the date of receipt of the offer. The sale price of the shares shall be determined in terms of Article 6.3(c) hereof.
answer: Yes, the contract includes a right of first offer. After a five-year period, if a party intends to sell any or all of its shares in the joint venture, it must first offer those shares to the other parties in proportion to their existing shareholding. The other parties have three weeks to accept the offer and specify the number of shares they intend to purchase.

question: Consider the Content License, Marketing, and Sales Agreement between eFashion Solutions, LLC and Playboy.com, Inc.; Is there a non-compete clause in this contract?

file_name: PlayboyEnterprisesInc_20090220_10-QA_EX-10.2_4091580_EX-10.2_Content License Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Sales-Purchase Agreement1.txt
answer: The contract includes a provision allowing the Client (Playboy.com, Inc.) to request that eFashion Solutions discontinue or modify any advertisement that is deemed inappropriate for the Client's brand or is competitive with the Client's business. However, this is not a standard non-compete clause but does give Playboy.com control over potentially competitive advertising.

question: Consider the License and Reseller Agreement between Ehave, Inc. and Companion Healthcare Technologies Corp.; What are the audit rights under this contract?
context: CHT shall provide to Ehave and its Auditors any assistance they may reasonably require to conduct such Audits. Audits may be conducted once a calendar year, provided that the foregoing limit shall not apply where an audit discovered an overcharge of 5% or more, in which case, Ehave may conduct another audit sooner. No period shall be audited more than once. Costs incurred by Ehave in connection with any audit or inspection conducted shall be borne by Ehave.
answer: Ehave, Inc. has the right to conduct audits of Companion Healthcare Technologies Corp. (CHT) once per calendar year. However, if an audit discovers an overcharge of 5% or more, Ehave may conduct another audit sooner. Each period can only be audited once, and the costs of any audit are to be borne by Ehave.

question: Consider the Development Agreement between Cargill, Incorporated and Bioamber S.A.S. for the Production of Succinic Acid; Is there a cap on liability under this contract?
context: Bioamber and Cargill agree to waive any and all claims against each other for consequential, punitive, incidental, special, or  other forms of "exemplary" losses whether arising in contract, warranty, tort (including negligence), strict liability, or otherwise, including  any losses relating to lost use, lost profits, lost business, damage to reputation, or lost or diminished financing unless such claims are  based on a Party's gross negligence or willful misconduct.
answer: Yes, the contract includes a limitation on liability. Cargill and Bioamber waive claims against each other for consequential, punitive, incidental, special, or exemplary damages, such as lost profits, lost business, or damage to reputation. However, this limitation does not apply to claims arising from a party's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

question: Consider the Strategic Alliance Agreement between Dialog Semiconductor (UK) Ltd and Energous Corporation; Is there a non-compete clause in this contract?
context: DIALOG will have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon the issuance of written notice to ENERGOUS (A) if ENERGOUS undergoes a Change of Control involving a competitor of DIALOG, or (B) if ENERGOUS acquires, whether directly through a sale of assets or through a Change of Control transaction, any competitor of DIALOG (as reasonably determined by DIALOG). ENERGOUS will provide DIALOG with notice of any such Change of Control or acquisition within [***] after the closing thereof and DIALOG's right to terminate the Agreement will expire [***] after receipt of such notice.
answer: The contract does not contain a standard non-compete clause. However, Dialog Semiconductor has the right to terminate the agreement if Energous undergoes a change of control involving a competitor of Dialog or if Energous acquires a competitor of Dialog. Energous is required to notify Dialog of such events, allowing Dialog to exercise its termination right.

question: Consider the Intellectual Property Agreement between Honeywell International Inc. and Garrett Motion Inc.; Are any of the licenses granted under this contract irrevocable or perpetual?

answer: Yes, the contract grants Garrett Motion Inc. (SpinCo) and its affiliates a non-exclusive, royalty-free, fully-paid, perpetual, sublicensable (to subsidiaries and suppliers for 'have-made' purposes), worldwide license to use the Honeywell Shared IP. This license is perpetual and limited to the type, scope, and extent of use as it was prior to the Distribution Date.

question: Consider the License and Reseller Agreement between Ehave, Inc. and Companion Healthcare Technologies Corp.; What are the insurance requirements under this contract?
context: Both Parties shall, at all times during the currency of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year after the termination or expiration of this Agreement, maintain the following policies of insurance in effect: (i) a comprehensive general liability insurance policy, with minimum coverage of $1,000,000 per occurrence and in the annual aggregate for product liability and completed operations, covering bodily and personal injury, including death, and property damage, including loss of use; and (ii) an information and network technology blended liability insurance policy with an insured limit of at least $1,000,000 in the aggregate.
answer: Both parties are required to maintain two types of insurance: (i) a comprehensive general liability insurance policy with a minimum coverage of $1,000,000 per occurrence and in the annual aggregate for product liability and completed operations, covering bodily and personal injury, including death, and property damage, including loss of use; and (ii) an information and network technology blended liability insurance policy with a minimum insured limit of $1,000,000 in aggregate. These policies must be maintained during the term of the agreement and for one year after its termination or expiration.

question: Consider the Outsourcing Agreement between Twin Cities Power Holdings, LLC and Redwater LLC for Administration of Renewable Notes; What are the audit rights under this contract?

The  Contractor shall supply copies of any such documents, files, or other records upon the request of the Company, as soon as is  reasonably and commercially practicable at the Company's cost and expense.

Redwater LLC is also required to provide copies of such documents upon request, at the cost and expense of Twin Cities Power Holdings.

question: Consider the Strategic Alliance Agreement among Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory, Inc., Farids & Co. LLC, and Edible Arrangements, LLC; Is there an anti-assignment clause in this contract?
context: The provisions of this Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns, provided, that, unless in connection with Permitted Transfers, neither party may assign, delegate or otherwise transfer any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement to any person without the express written consent of the other party hereto and any such assignment or other transfer shall be null and void; provided, further, that no such assignment shall relieve the assigning party of its obligations hereunder if such assignee does not perform such obligations.
answer: Yes, the contract contains an anti-assignment clause. Neither party may assign, delegate, or transfer its rights or obligations under the agreement to any person without the express written consent of the other party, except in the case of Permitted Transfers. Any unauthorized assignment is considered null and void, and the assigning party remains responsible if the assignee fails to perform the obligations.

question: Consider the License and Reseller Agreement between Ehave, Inc. and Companion Healthcare Technologies Corp.; Are the licenses granted under this contract non-transferable?

question: Consider the Exclusive Distributor Agreement between IMRS Operations Inc. and Delteq Pte Ltd.; Is there a cap on liability under this contract?
context: IN NO EVENT SHALL DEVELOPER BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OF PROFIT OR ANY OTHER COMMERCIAL DAMAGE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR OTHER INDIRECT DAMAGES UNDER ANY CAUSE OF ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CLAIMS ARISING FROM MALFUNCTION OR DEFECTS IN THE PRODUCTS. DEVELOPER'S MAXIMUM LIABILITY HEREUNDER IS EXPRESSLY LIMITED TO THE LESSER OF: THE AMOUNT PAID UNDER THIS AGREEMENT BY DISTRIBUTOR TO DEVELOPER WITHIN THE SIX (6) MONTH PERIOD IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING THE CAUSE GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM; OR FIVE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS ($5OO,000).
answer: Yes, the contract includes a cap on liability. Developer's maximum liability is limited to the lesser of the amount paid by the distributor to the developer in the six months preceding the claim or $500,000. Additionally, the contract excludes liability for loss of profit and various forms of indirect, incidental, or consequential damages.

question: Consider the Sponsorship Agreement between Forty Niners SC Stadium Company LLC and Violin Memory, Inc.; Does this contract include an exclusivity agreement?

question: Consider the Endorsement Agreement between SQUARE TWO GOLF INC. and Kathy Whitworth for Women's Golf Clubs; Does this contract include any volume restrictions?
context: The Professional agrees to serve as a professional golf instructor during up to ten (10) golf clinics hosted by the Company per calendar year at locations within the United States to be determined by the Company.
answer: Yes, the contract includes a volume restriction specifying that Kathy Whitworth agrees to serve as a golf instructor at up to ten golf clinics per calendar year, hosted by the company within the United States.

question: Consider the Franchise Agreement between Goosehead Insurance Agency, LLC and Franchisee; What is the governing law for this contract?
context:
This Agreement will be interpreted and construed exclusively under the laws of the State of Texas, which laws will prevail in the event of any conflict of law (without regard to, and without giving effect to, the application of Texas choice-of-law rules); provided, however, that if the covenants in Section 19 of this Agreement would not be enforced as written under

Page 55 of 80





Texas law, then the parties agree that those covenants will instead be interpreted and construed under the laws of the state in which the Franchised Business is located.
answer: The governing law for this contract is the laws of the State of Texas. However, if the covenants in Section 19 cannot be enforced as written under Texas law, they will be interpreted under the laws of the state in which the franchised business is located.

question: Consider the Distributor Agreement between VendingData Corporation and Technical Casino Supplies Ltd for Casino Products; What licenses are granted under this contract?
context: In the event of the termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever, the exclusive distribution right and license granted to Distributor pursuant to this Agreement shall automatically revert to Vendor as Vendor's sole property.
answer: The contract grants an exclusive distribution right and license to the distributor. However, upon termination of the agreement, this right and license will automatically revert to the vendor as the vendorâ€™s sole property.

question: Consider the Affiliate Agreement between Southern Star Energy Inc. and element 5 GmbH; What is the governing law for this contract?
context: Even in case of agreements with foreign (non-German) Software Publishers and Affiliates, the law of the Federal Republic of Germany applies.
answer: The governing law for this contract is the law of the Federal Republic of Germany, even for agreements with foreign (non-German) software publishers and affiliates.

question: Consider the Technology Outsourcing Agreement between Oriental Financial Group Inc. and Metavante Corporation; Is there an anti-assignment clause in this contract?
context: Neither this Agreement nor the rights or obligations hereunder may be assigned by either party, by operation of law or otherwise, without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, provided that (a) Metavante's consent need not be obtained in connection with the assignment of this Agreement pursuant to a merger in which Customer is a party and as a result of which the surviving Entity becomes an Affiliate or Subsidiary of another bank holding company, bank, savings and loan association or other financial institution, so long as the provisions of all applicable Schedules are complied with; and (b) Metavante may freely assign this Agreement so long as it is (i) in connection with a merger, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets, stock, or securities, or (ii) to any Entity which is a successor to the assets or the business of Metavante.
answer: Yes, the contract includes an anti-assignment clause. Neither party may assign the agreement or its rights or obligations without the prior written consent of the other party, except under specific conditions, such as mergers or reorganization. Metavante may freely assign the agreement in connection with a merger, corporate reorganization, or sale of its assets or business.

question: Consider the Intellectual Property Agreement between WestRock Company and Ingevity Corporation; Are the licenses granted under this contract non-transferable?
context: If Parent enters an agreement to transfer the license granted to it under this Section 3.1 in connection with any sale or transfer of a Parent business, then SpinCo and members of the SpinCo Group shall be made third party beneficiaries under such transfer agreement to enforce breaches of the license.   3
answer: No, the licenses granted under this contract are transferable. The context mentions that the license can be transferred in connection with a sale or transfer of a Parent business, and SpinCo and its group members would be third-party beneficiaries to enforce breaches of the license.

question: Consider the Wireless Content License Agreement between Twentieth Century Fox Licensing & Merchandising and Sorrent, Inc.; Does this contract include any revenue or profit-sharing arrangements?
context:
Payments from Licensee to Fox: In consideration of the rights granted to Licensee pursuant to this Agreement, Licensee shall pay to Fox, or such other party as Fox may designate in writing, a royalty in the following amounts:

(i) Major Releases:

(A) Until such time as ***** percent (*****%) of an Individual Property Guarantee for a Major Release is recouped by Licensee, Fox shall earn, and credit against the Individual Property Guarantees, Royalties at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts from Licensee's sale, license, distribution or other exploitation of the Wireless Products derived from the respective Major Release; and

(B) Thereafter and until such time as ***** percent (*****%) of an Individual Property Guarantee for a Major Release is recouped by Licensee, Fox shall earn and Licensee shall pay to Fox Royalties at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts from Licensee's sale, license, distribution or other exploitation of the Wireless Products derived from the respective Major Release; and

(C) Thereafter (and for the remainder of the Term), Fox shall earn and Licensee shall pay to Fox Royalties at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts from Licensee's sale, license, distribution or other exploitation of the Wireless Products derived from the respective Major Release.
answer: Yes, the contract includes revenue-sharing arrangements. Sorrent, Inc. is required to pay royalties to Twentieth Century Fox based on a percentage of Sorrent's gross receipts from the sale, license, distribution, or other exploitation of wireless products derived from major releases. The royalty rate and payment structure vary depending on whether certain financial thresholds (Individual Property Guarantees) have been recouped by Sorrent.
